newsitem.title: USA: Cowles to lay off up to 31 people at book unit.
newsitem.headline: Cowles to lay off up to 31 people at book unit.

text.p: Cowles Creative Publishing Inc said on Thursday it plans to eliminate up to 31 jobs primarily in its book development unit at the company's Minnetonka headquarters.

Cowles Creative Publishing, a unit of Cowles Media Inc, said it is currently staffed to deliver more products than some of its markets need at this time, and its future product development plans do not require the staffing it now has.

Sixteen positions would be eliminated by December 2 and up to an additional 15 positions are expected to be eliminated by March 31, 1997. Currently there are about 70 people assigned to the book development unit and 158 employees in total at the operation.
The specialist positions being eliminated are primarily in the art, design and editorial areas.
The company is providing severance payments and outplacement assistance and support.

Cowles Creative Publishing is a specialty publisher of series books in the home arts, do-it-yourself, recreation and history markets. In addition to its book development programs, the company also offers creative services and video production unit. It was acquired by Cowles in 1994.
